intro: Pimelea altior var. longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf pimelea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it prefers well-drained conditions.
